required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Summer Camp Study 2: Blood Glucose Control With a Bi-Hormonal Endocrine Pancreas
clinical_study.official_title: The Summer Camp Study 2: Outpatient Automated Blood Glucose Control With a Bi-Hormonal Bionic Endocrine Pancreas in a Pediatric Population Ages 6-11 at the Clara Barton Diabetes Camps

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test the hypothesis that a wearable automated bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers both insulin and glucagon can improve glycemic control vs. usual care for young people with type 1 diabetes ages 6-11 years old in a diabetes camp environment.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Continuous Glucose Monitoring Glucose (CGMG) Values During Days 2 to 5
primary_outcome.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The CGM glucose results during Days 2 through 5 were averaged.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time Spent With CGMG Concentration < 60 mg/dL During Days 2 to 5
primary_outcome.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The percentage of time that the glucose concentration was less than 60 mg/dL [3.3 millimoles/liter (mmol/L)] during Days 2 through 5 was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean CGMG Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Days 1-5 in each period
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The glucose results for each time frame were averaged.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time With CGMG Concentration by Ranges During Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose readings were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The percentage of time that the glucose concentration was less than the following ranges were calculated: < 50 mg/dL(2.8 mmol/L), < 70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L), 70-180 mg/dL (3.9 to 10.0 mmol/L), > 180 mg/dL (10.0 mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time With CGMG Concentration by Ranges During Days 1 to 5
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose readings were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The percentage of time that the glucose concentration was less than the following ranges were calculated: < 50 mg/dl (2.8 mmol/L), < 70 mg/dl (3.9 mmol/L), 70-180 mg/dl (3.9 to 10.0 mmol/L), > 180 mg/dL (10.0 mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time With CGMG Concentration by Ranges During Days 2 to 5
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose readings were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The percentage of time that the glucose concentration was less than the following ranges were calculated: < 50 mg/dl (2.8 mmol/L), < 70 mg/dl (3.9 mmol/L), 70-180 mg/dl (3.9 to 10.0 mmol/L), > 180 mg/dL (10.0 mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mean CGMG Glucose <154 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The glucose readings were averaged. 154 mg/dL was the estimated average glucose corresponding to a Hemoglobin A1C of 7.0%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mean CGMG Glucose <169 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The glucose readings were averaged. 169 mg/dL was the estimated average glucose corresponding to a Hemoglobin A1C of 7.5%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mean CGMG Glucose <183 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The glucose readings were averaged. 183 mg/dL was the estimated average glucose corresponding to a Hemoglobin A1C of 8.0%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of CGMG Reported Hypoglycemic Events (< 70 mg/dL, < 60 mg/dL, <50 mg/dL)
secondary_outcome.description: A series of hypoglycemic measurements is defined as a single event until there is a break of â‰¥ 30 minutes between measurements below the defined thresholds of < 70, < 60, and <50 mg/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Plasma Glucose Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1 to 5, and Days 2 to 5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The plasma glucose readings were averaged. The plasma glucose results on Day 1, Days 1 to 5 and Days 2 to 5 were averaged.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time With Plasma Glucose Values by Ranges on Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The percentage of time that the plasma glucose concentration was less than the following ranges were calculated: < 70 mg/dl (3.9 mmol/L), < 60 mg/dL (3.3 mmol/L), < 50 mg/dl (2.8 mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time With Plasma Glucose Values by Ranges on Days 1 to 5
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The percentage of time that the plasma glucose concentration was less than the following ranges were calculated: < 70 mg/dL (3.9 mmol/L), < 60 mg/dL (3.3 mmol/L), < 50 mg/dL (2.8 mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time With Plasma Glucose Values by Ranges on Days 2 to 5
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The percentage of time that the plasma glucose concentration was less than the following ranges were calculated: < 70 mg/dl (3.9 mmol/L), < 60 mg/dL (3.3 mmol/L), < 50 mg/dl (2.8 mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mean Plasma Glucose <154 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1 to 5, and Days 2 to 5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The plasma glucose readings were averaged. 154 mg/dL was the estimated average glucose corresponding to a Hemoglobin A1C of 7.0%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mean Plasma Glucose <169 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1 to 5, and Days 2 to 5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The plasma glucose readings were averaged. 169 mg/dL was the estimated average glucose corresponding to a Hemoglobin A1C of 7.5%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mean Plasma Glucose <183 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1 to 5, and Days 2 to 5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The plasma glucose readings were averaged. 183 mg/dL was the estimated average glucose corresponding to a Hemoglobin A1C of 8.0%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Plasma Glucose Reported Hypoglycemic Events (< 70 mg/dL, < 60 mg/dL, <50 mg/dL)
secondary_outcome.description: A series of hypoglycemic measurements is defined as a single event until there is a break of â‰¥ 30 minutes between measurements below the defined thresholds of < 70, < 60, and <50 mg/dL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Days That CGM Data Was Used by Participants as Part of Their Usual Care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of the Usual Care Period
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of days during the Usual Care period that participants used CGM data as part of their diabetes management.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Carbohydrate Interventions for Hypoglycemia When Plasma Glucose <70 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). Participants were given 15 grams (g) of simple carbohydrates if their plasma glucose concentration dropped below 4.4 mmol/L. These simple carbohydrates were counted as interventions for study outcomes if the plasma glucose concentration was less than 3.9 mmol/L. A second intervention of 15 g of carbohydrate was given if a repeat measurement in 15-20 min was less than 3.9 mmol/L. The total number of carbohydrate interventions are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Grams of Carbohydrate Taken for Hypoglycemia When Plasma Glucose <70 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). Participants were given 15 grams (g) of simple carbohydrates if their plasma glucose concentration dropped below 4.4 mmol/L. These simple carbohydrates were counted as interventions for study outcomes if the plasma glucose concentration was less than 3.9 mmol/L. A second intervention of 15 g of carbohydrate was given if a repeat measurement in 15-20 min was less than 3.9 mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Insulin Total Daily Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Insulin total daily dose is reported in units per kilogram per day (U/kg/day).

secondary_outcome.measure: Glucagon Total Daily Dose Levels in the Bionic Pancreas Arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
secondary_outcome.description: Glucagon dose level is reported in micrograms per kilogram of body mass per day (Âµg/kg/day).

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily Basal Insulin Dose in the Bionic Pancreas Period
secondary_outcome.description: The bionic pancreas automatically adapted insulin dosing to each individual's needs. When CGM data were not available (because of sensor failure or during the warm-up time after sensor replacement), the bionic pancreas automatically delivered a dose of basal insulin based on the mean basal dosing it had calculated at that time on previous days. Daily basal insulin dose is reported in units per kilogram (kg) per day (U/kg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily Bolus Insulin Dose in the Bionic Pancreas Period
secondary_outcome.description: The first time the bionic pancreas was used in each participant, a partial meal-priming bolus based on the participant's body mass (0.05 units/kg) was delivered. After the first use, the size of the meal-priming bolus was adapted by the bionic pancreas to 75% of the 4-hour prandial insulin used for that meal type and size. Daily bolus insulin dose is reported in units per kilogram (kg) per day (U/kg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Carbohydrate Intake
secondary_outcome.description: Carbohydrate intake included meals, snacks and unscheduled carbohydrates administered when a participant's blood glucose was <80 mg/dl (or for symptoms at any glucose level). Carbohydrate intake per day was averaged and is reported in grams (g) per kilogram (kg) per day (g/kg/day).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Unscheduled Infusion Set Changes
secondary_outcome.description: Infusion sets for administering insulin and glucagon were placed under the skin the in the abdomen, buttocks, arms, or legs. Infusion set changes due to pain, infusion set falling out or infusion set failure are reported. Camp policy was to suspect failure of the infusion set whenever ketonemia occurred, so failures may not have actually been set failures, but rather failure to deliver enough insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Unscheduled Infusion Set Changes
secondary_outcome.description: Infusion sets for administering insulin and glucagon were placed under the skin the in the abdomen, buttocks, arms, or legs. Infusion set changes due to pain, infusion set falling out or infusion set failure are reported. Camp policy was to suspect failure of the infusion set whenever ketonemia occurred, so failures may not have actually been set failures, but rather failure to deliver enough insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Unscheduled Infusion Set Changes
secondary_outcome.description: Infusion sets for administering insulin and glucagon were placed under the skin the in the abdomen, buttocks, arms, or legs. Infusion set changes due to pain, infusion set falling out or infusion set failure are reported. Camp policy was to suspect failure of the infusion set whenever ketonemia occurred, so failures may not have actually been set failures, but rather failure to deliver enough insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Bionic Pancreas Local Infusion Site Reactions
secondary_outcome.description: Local infusion site reactions are defined as pain at the infusion site of the Bionic Pancreas. Itching and redness may have also been present.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Nausea Index Score Using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 in each period
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated their nausea using a 0 to 10 centimeter (cm) VAS where 0=least severe nausea to 10=most severe nausea. The average nausea index scores from Day 1 to Day 5 were calculated

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Severe Hypoglycemic Events
secondary_outcome.description: A severe hypoglycemic event is an event where the participant is unable to self-treat and requires the assistance of another person.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time Participants Were Not Under Bionic Pancreas Control During the Bionic Pancreas Period
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time that the Bionic pancreas was not functioning properly due to loss of wireless connectivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time Without CGM Monitoring Data
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time without CGM monitoring data is the time when the participant's CGM device lost its CGM signal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: The change in body weight collected at Day 5 of each period relative to Baseline. A negative change from Baseline indicates a reduction in body weight and a positive change from Baseline indicates an increase in body weight.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reliability Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 in each period
secondary_outcome.description: Reliability index was calculated as the percentage of time values were actually recorded by CGM.

secondary_outcome.measure: List of Technical Faults Associated With the Bionic Pancreas Including Cause and Resolution
Number of Unscheduled CGM Sensor Changes
secondary_outcome.description: The number of time a CGM sensor was replaced due to falling out or failing to report a glucose value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Using a Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) Agonist During the Usual Care Period
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who used a GLP-1 agonist to manage their diabetes during the Usual Care period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Using Pramlintide During the Usual Care Period
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who used pramlintide to manage their diabetes during the Usual Care period.

arm_group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

intervention.description: Automated blood glucose control via a closed-loop bionic pancreas device.
As a comparator control, usual diabetes camp care with the participant's own insulin pump.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Age 6-11 years with type 1 diabetes for at least one year
- Diabetes managed using an insulin infusion pump for â‰¥ three months
- Willing to wear two infusion sets and continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) sensor and change sets frequently (at least one new glucagon infusion set daily)
- Otherwise healthy (mild chronic disease such as asthma will be allowed if well controlled that do not require medications that result in exclusion)
Exclusion Criteria
- Unable to provide informed consent, informed assent or parental consent
- Unable to comply with study procedures
- Current participation in another diabetes-related clinical trial that, in the judgment of the principal investigator, will compromise the results of this study or the safety of the subject
- End stage renal disease on dialysis (hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis)
- Pregnancy (positive urine human chorionic gonadotropin [HCG])
- History of liver disease that is expected to interfere with the anti-hypoglycemia action of glucagon (e.g. liver failure or cirrhosis). Other liver disease (i.e. active hepatitis, steatosis, active biliary disease, any tumor of the liver, hemochromatosis, glycogen storage disease) may exclude the subject if it causes significant compromise to liver function or may do so in an unpredictable fashion
- Personal history of cystic fibrosis, pancreatitis, or other pancreatic disease, including pancreatic tumor or insulinoma
- History of prolonged QT or arrhythmia, congenital heart disease or current known cardiac disease
- Acute illness (other than non-vomiting viral illness) or exacerbation of chronic illness other than type 1 diabetes (T1D) at the time of the study
- Seizure disorder, history of any seizure within the last two years, or ongoing treatment with anticonvulsants
- Untreated or inadequately treated mental illness (indicators would include symptoms such as psychosis, hallucinations, mania, and any psychiatric hospitalization in the last year), or treatment with second generation anti-psychotic medications, which are known to affect glucose regulation.
- Electrically powered implants (e.g. cochlear implants, neurostimulators) that might be susceptible to radio-frequency (RF) interference
- Use of oral (e.g. thiazolidinediones, biguanides, sulfonylureas, glitinides, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP-4) inhibitors, sodium-glucose linked transporter 2 (SGLT-2) inhibitors) anti-diabetic medications
- History of adverse reaction to glucagon (including allergy) besides nausea and vomiting.
- Unwilling or unable to completely avoid acetaminophen during the comparator and bionic pancreas arms of the study
- History of eating disorder such as anorexia, bulimia, or diabulemia or omission of insulin to manipulate weight
- History of intentional, inappropriate administration of insulin leading to severe hypoglycemia requiring treatment
- Any factors that, in the opinion of the principal investigator, would interfere with the safe completion of the study procedures

link.description: Information about this and related studies

group.title: Bionic Pancreas Then Usual Care
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days in Period 1, followed by Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days in Period 2. There was a 3-day washout period between periods.

group.title: Usual Care Then Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days in Period 1, followed by Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a CGM device, for 5 days in Period 2. There was a 3-day washout period between periods.

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

measure.title: Age
Age
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The CGM glucose results during Days 2 through 5 were averaged.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

measure.description: Glucose reading were taken every 5 minutes by the CGM. The glucose readings were averaged. 183 mg/dL was the estimated average glucose corresponding to a Hemoglobin A1C of 8.0%.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Number of CGMG Reported Hypoglycemic Events (< 70 mg/dL, < 60 mg/dL, <50 mg/dL)
outcome.description: A series of hypoglycemic measurements is defined as a single event until there is a break of â‰¥ 30 minutes between measurements below the defined thresholds of < 70, < 60, and <50 mg/dL.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.title: Number of CGMG Reported Hypoglycemic Events (< 70 mg/dL, < 60 mg/dL, <50 mg/dL)
measure.description: A series of hypoglycemic measurements is defined as a single event until there is a break of â‰¥ 30 minutes between measurements below the defined thresholds of < 70, < 60, and <50 mg/dL.

outcome.title: Mean Plasma Glucose Values
outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The plasma glucose readings were averaged. The plasma glucose results on Day 1, Days 1 to 5 and Days 2 to 5 were averaged.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1 to 5, and Days 2 to 5 of each period
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.title: Mean Plasma Glucose Values
measure.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The plasma glucose readings were averaged. The plasma glucose results on Day 1, Days 1 to 5 and Days 2 to 5 were averaged.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Time With Plasma Glucose Values by Ranges on Day 1
outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). The percentage of time that the plasma glucose concentration was less than the following ranges were calculated: < 70 mg/dl (3.9 mmol/L), < 60 mg/dL (3.3 mmol/L), < 50 mg/dl (2.8 mmol/L).
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

outcome.title: Percentage of Days That CGM Data Was Used by Participants as Part of Their Usual Care
outcome.description: The percentage of days during the Usual Care period that participants used CGM data as part of their diabetes management.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of the Usual Care Period
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Days That CGM Data Was Used by Participants as Part of Their Usual Care
measure.description: The percentage of days during the Usual Care period that participants used CGM data as part of their diabetes management.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Number of Carbohydrate Interventions for Hypoglycemia When Plasma Glucose <70 mg/dL
outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). Participants were given 15 grams (g) of simple carbohydrates if their plasma glucose concentration dropped below 4.4 mmol/L. These simple carbohydrates were counted as interventions for study outcomes if the plasma glucose concentration was less than 3.9 mmol/L. A second intervention of 15 g of carbohydrate was given if a repeat measurement in 15-20 min was less than 3.9 mmol/L. The total number of carbohydrate interventions are reported.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). These simple carbohydrates were counted as interventions for study outcomes if the plasma glucose concentration was less than 3.9 mmol/L. A second intervention of 15 g of carbohydrate was given if a repeat measurement in 15-20 min was less than 3.9 mmol/L. The total number of carbohydrate interventions are reported.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.description: Fingerstick plasma glucose measurements were obtained before meals, at bedtime, at midnight, and at about 3:45 AM (six scheduled measurements). Participants were given 15 grams (g) of simple carbohydrates if their plasma glucose concentration dropped below 4.4 mmol/L. These simple carbohydrates were counted as interventions for study outcomes if the plasma glucose concentration was less than 3.9 mmol/L. A second intervention of 15 g of carbohydrate was given if a repeat measurement in 15â€“20 min was less than 3.9 mmol/L.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

A second intervention of 15 g of carbohydrate was given if a repeat measurement in 15â€“20 min was less than 3.9 mmol/L.

outcome.title: Insulin Total Daily Dose
outcome.description: Insulin total daily dose is reported in units per kilogram per day (U/kg/day).
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.title: Insulin Total Daily Dose
measure.description: Insulin total daily dose is reported in units per kilogram per day (U/kg/day).
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Glucagon Total Daily Dose Levels in the Bionic Pancreas Arm
outcome.description: Glucagon dose level is reported in micrograms per kilogram of body mass per day (Âµg/kg/day).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 of each period
outcome.population: All participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

measure.title: Glucagon Total Daily Dose Levels in the Bionic Pancreas Arm
measure.description: Glucagon dose level is reported in micrograms per kilogram of body mass per day (Âµg/kg/day).
measure.population: All participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

outcome.title: Daily Basal Insulin Dose in the Bionic Pancreas Period
outcome.description: The bionic pancreas automatically adapted insulin dosing to each individualâ€™s needs. When CGM data were not available (because of sensor failure or during the warm-up time after sensor replacement), the bionic pancreas automatically delivered a dose of basal insulin based on the mean basal dosing it had calculated at that time on previous days. Daily basal insulin dose is reported in units per kilogram (kg) per day (U/kg).
outcome.population: All participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

measure.title: Daily Basal Insulin Dose in the Bionic Pancreas Period
measure.description: The bionic pancreas automatically adapted insulin dosing to each individualâ€™s needs. When CGM data were not available (because of sensor failure or during the warm-up time after sensor replacement), the bionic pancreas automatically delivered a dose of basal insulin based on the mean basal dosing it had calculated at that time on previous days. Daily basal insulin dose is reported in units per kilogram (kg) per day (U/kg).
measure.population: All participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

outcome.title: Daily Bolus Insulin Dose in the Bionic Pancreas Period
outcome.description: The first time the bionic pancreas was used in each participant, a partial meal-priming bolus based on the participantâ€™s body mass (0.05 units/kg) was delivered. After the first use, the size of the meal-priming bolus was adapted by the bionic pancreas to 75% of the 4-hour prandial insulin used for that meal type and size. Daily bolus insulin dose is reported in units per kilogram (kg) per day (U/kg).
outcome.population: All participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Participants who were randomized and began in the trial

measure.title: Daily Bolus Insulin Dose in the Bionic Pancreas Period
measure.description: The first time the bionic pancreas was used in each participant, a partial meal-priming bolus based on the participantâ€™s body mass (0.05 units/kg) was delivered. After the first use, the size of the meal-priming bolus was adapted by the bionic pancreas to 75% of the 4-hour prandial insulin used for that meal type and size. Daily bolus insulin dose is reported in units per kilogram (kg) per day (U/kg).
measure.population: All participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

outcome.title: Carbohydrate Intake
outcome.description: Carbohydrate intake included meals, snacks and unscheduled carbohydrates administered when a participant's blood glucose was <80 mg/dl (or for symptoms at any glucose level). Carbohydrate intake per day was averaged and is reported in grams (g) per kilogram (kg) per day (g/kg/day).
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.title: Carbohydrate Intake
measure.description: Carbohydrate intake included meals, snacks and unscheduled carbohydrates administered when a participant's blood glucose was <80 mg/dl (or for symptoms at any glucose level). Carbohydrate intake per day was averaged and is reported in grams (g) per kilogram (kg) per day (g/kg/day).
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Number of Unscheduled Infusion Set Changes
outcome.description: Infusion sets for administering insulin and glucagon were placed under the skin the in the abdomen, buttocks, arms, or legs. Infusion set changes due to pain, infusion set falling out or infusion set failure are reported. Camp policy was to suspect failure of the infusion set whenever ketonemia occurred, so failures may not have actually been set failures, but rather failure to deliver enough insulin.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Number of Bionic Pancreas Local Infusion Site Reactions
outcome.description: Local infusion site reactions are defined as pain at the infusion site of the Bionic Pancreas. Itching and redness may have also been present.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

measure.title: Number of Bionic Pancreas Local Infusion Site Reactions
measure.description: Local infusion site reactions are defined as pain at the infusion site of the Bionic Pancreas. Itching and redness may have also been present.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

outcome.title: Mean Nausea Index Score Using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
outcome.description: Participants rated their nausea using a 0 to 10 centimeter (cm) VAS where 0=least severe nausea to 10=most severe nausea. The average nausea index scores from Day 1 to Day 5 were calculated
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 in each period
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

measure.title: Mean Nausea Index Score Using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
measure.description: Participants rated their nausea using a 0 to 10 centimeter (cm) VAS where 0=least severe nausea to 10=most severe nausea. The average nausea index scores from Day 1 to Day 5 were calculated
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Number of Severe Hypoglycemic Events
outcome.description: A severe hypoglycemic event is an event where the participant is unable to self-treat and requires the assistance of another person.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

measure.description: A severe hypoglycemic event is an event where the participant is unable to self-treat and requires the assistance of another person.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Time Participants Were Not Under Bionic Pancreas Control During the Bionic Pancreas Period
outcome.description: Percentage of time that the Bionic pancreas was not functioning properly due to loss of wireless connectivity.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study. Reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Time Participants Were Not Under Bionic Pancreas Control During the Bionic Pancreas Period
measure.description: Percentage of time that the Bionic pancreas was not functioning properly due to loss of wireless connectivity.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study. Reported for the Bionic Pancreas period only.

class.title: Insulin Pump: Loss of Wireless Connectivity
Glucagon Pump: Loss of Wireless Connectivity

outcome.title: Percentage of Time Without CGM Monitoring Data
outcome.description: Percentage of time without CGM monitoring data is the time when the participant's CGM device lost its CGM signal.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Time Without CGM Monitoring Data
measure.description: Percentage of time without CGM monitoring data is the time when the participant's CGM device lost its CGM signal.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
outcome.description: The change in body weight collected at Day 5 of each period relative to Baseline. A negative change from Baseline indicates a reduction in body weight and a positive change from Baseline indicates an increase in body weight.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

group.title: Bionic Pancreas
group.description: Bionic Pancreas diabetes management, a wearable bionic pancreas system that automatically delivers insulin and glucagon using a continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) device, for 5 days.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Usual Care diabetes management in a diabetes camp environment including a nurse or nursing student assigned to each cabin and review and adjustment of the insulin regimen daily by a physician or nurse practitioner, all participants using the participant's own insulin pump and a continuous glucose monitor if they use one as part of their usual care, for 5 days.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
measure.description: The change in body weight collected at Day 5 of each period relative to Baseline. A negative change from Baseline indicates a reduction in body weight and a positive change from Baseline indicates an increase in body weight.
measure.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Reliability Index
outcome.description: Reliability index was calculated as the percentage of time values were actually recorded by CGM.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Days 1-5, and Days 2-5 in each period
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Number of Unscheduled CGM Sensor Changes
outcome.description: The number of time a CGM sensor was replaced due to falling out or failing to report a glucose value.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who completed both periods of the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Using a Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) Agonist During the Usual Care Period
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who used a GLP-1 agonist to manage their diabetes during the Usual Care period.
outcome.population: All participants who completed both periods of the study. Results are reported for the Usual Care period only.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
